subject: Re: Run for lives!--or not.
author: Fiona Broome
full_text:
Dear Ms. Abercrombie:

It seems that you misunderstand how some of us react to posts by "RJ."

It's not his (or her) tests that are so troublesome, though they sound a little silly to me.  To me, they're rather like someone clearly holding the salt cellar in one hand and asking me, "Which hand has the salt?"

If it's a small child asking, that's amusing.  If it's an adult, it seems a bit insulting.  I don't expect the spirits to feel any differently.

But that's neither here nor there; the tests are not the issue.

What is troublesome is the rhetoric chosen by RJ. While sarcasm rarely conveys well in text, RJ's posts are so dripping with sarcasm, the tone is impossible to overlook.  

Further, arguing over this seems a waste of everyone's time.  I doubt that anyone is going to change his or her mind. If this group's primary function is to swap insults rather than pool research results and brainstorm new approaches to this science, I should probably leave.

Sincerely,
Fiona Broome



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:
>
> For the record, I appreciate RJ's contribution here, and what he is trying
> to accomplish with these tests. No one should have any problem not the
> skeptics, nor the believers. The outcome of the tests won't mean anything to
> anyone except those who wish to remain objective. I do not understand why
> some people here are so threatened by these tests.
>
